answers.answer: Hi,Most nipple discharges are very common and sometimes caused by benign conditions, such as duct ectasia or benign papillomas.Discharge from the breast, when nipples are squeezed,increases the Prolactin hormone level and the more you squeeze the nipple the more the discharge will continue.This fluid can be many colors... green, gray,yellow, etc.Women who are on birth control pills and some tranquilizers, produce more prolactin and may have more discharge.It becomes alarming when the discharge happens only on one side, comes out spontaneously( without squeezing),is persistent, bloody or clear and sticky like egg white.I can understand your anxiety,but I don't think that you should be overly worried about it,because most discharges are not indicative of something bad, particularly when the discharge is bilateral.However if you are overly concerned, I think it would be wise to mention this discharge to your physician,just to be on the safe side.Take care and best wishes...

question: I am 46 and have a sticky yellow discharge coming from both nipples. It can't be an infection as I have been on antibiotics constantly for the past three weeks for another infection due to my diabetes. What is this and should I be worried?
title: Scared of breast discharge
